Topic.Title: Cramer just now says stocks are about to "GO OVER A CLIFF"--big selloff!

Message.Msg: Xdon69, how much have you lost playing with AMZN since your arrival here several weeks ago? You couldn't make money shorting AMZN, so you turned long recently, huh? And she weakens suddenly. Welcome to one of the toughest stocks to trade.
Yeah, but techstrategy, does your wife know almost all of your savings and hers are gone due to your "speculating" in the stock market?

"Yahoo says bid is $252, with no offer price." A massive short squeeze? No one is selling? Don't get excited ex.goldbug. That's said, the US stock market can be weak tomorrow because the Japanese stock market has shown signs of getting really strong in the last few days. Japanese financial institutions may liquidate their holdings here to repatriate their money to shove into their market back home.
AAPL is a real short. AMZN is for scalping. Since you nor Sybil is good at taking small sure profits judiciously, you lose money shorting AMZN.

Because our resident twitter girl, xdon69 went long AMZN recently (after losing money shorting AMZN for weeks), I believe there's a good chance AMZN could remain weak for a few days until she gives up and dump her long position at a loss.
"Friday--either Ugly, or Very Ugly" For shorts or longs?

This business relationship between Bezos and Blodget is especially appropriate. They are both Market crooks. Blodget was a Wall Street Analyst that pumped the crooked dealings of Bernie Ebbers at Worldcom, which landed Bernie Ebbers in jail (and still there) and Henry Blodget being disbarred from the financial industry (but it appears we can't get rid of him). Bernie Ebbers was put in jail by roping in investors by describing profits that weren't there. Jeffy won't end up in jail because he has never said there are any profits or when there would be any profits. But Worldcom and Amazon look the same in every other way!
